occupation: Director of People and Culture at Access Systems, Inc.
headline: Director of People and Culture at Access Systems, Inc.
summary:
My responsibility and role at Access Systems is to lead the Human Resources and Marketing departments. Our focus is to drive this “growth engine” by recruiting great candidates, retaining valuable employees and engaging our team internally and throughout the communities we serve. Over the past 14 years, we have seen an average of 46% YOY growth. I have 24+ years of experience in sales, marketing and management both in for-profit and non-profit environments. My most significant contribution at Access Systems is working to maintain our "people first" culture that provides exceptional customer service and gives back to the communities where we work and live. 

In February of 2014, I read a quote that really resonated with me  – ‘If you’re offered a seat on a rocket ship, you don’t ask what seat. You just get on.’ (Lean In, Sheryl Sandberg) Just as the author shared; Access is a rocket ship, and just as important, Access has a mission and culture that I believe in.

Along with our people and culture, I am focused on continually updating and refreshing Access’ corporate brand. “We have an incredible story to share – one of growth, stability and vision; all the needed elements to foster strong, lasting customer relationships and fulfill career goals for our employees.”

experiences.title: Director of People and Culture
experiences.description: Responsibilities include fundraising, fiscal management, strategic vision, leadership, and sustainability. I also love to be involved with direct service and execute programming directed by the program staff. It is a joy to do community outreach and awareness to further Amanda's mission to bring hope and healing to grieving children and families.

experiences.company: Amanda the Panda Family Grief Center
experiences.title: Executive Director
experiences.description: In Sales and Sales Management from 1999 till 2005. Starting in May of 2005 till February 2008 provided new hire training via the web, nationwide and also provided live workshop training in Illinois, Kentucky/Indiana and Minnesota/Iowa areas.

experiences.title: Sales Force Development Trainer
experiences.description: Starting selling for the Business Document Services division out of the Cedar Rapids office in May. As this area of focus grew for IKON, I stepped into a Sales Manager role overseeing sales teams in Cedar Rapids, Des Moines, and Omaha. Then in 2001, moved to the Des Moines office to take over a Major Account role selling in central Iowa.

accomplishment_organisations.description:
MISSION of the Consortium, a business club founded in 1978: The Consortium supports, develops and promotes women leaders through education, mentoring and networking for personal and professional growth. 

PURPOSE of the Consortium:  A. Networking, both business and professional; to connect with women in the community; B. Support, both personal and professional; C. Education, a forum to learn about our community and organizations in the community; and D. Camaraderie and social opportunities

Connection. Growth. Goals. Books.

MAP Professional Development, Inc. - Dr. Christi Hegstad

The ASPIRE Success Club is ideal for the woman who wants to grow professionally, connect with other like-minded women, and achieve a Bold Goal by year-end. A recent survey also found that over 90% of ASPIRE members gained business or advanced their careers due to their membership. It's a powerful group!

WDMLA Graduate - Class of 2013 - 2014

The West Des Moines Leadership Academy (WDMLA) is an intensive, regionally-oriented leadership development program designed to give potential and emerging leaders the skills, knowledge, and ongoing support they need to succeed in the West Des Moines community.

It is designed for outstanding individuals who desire to sharpen their leadership skills and gain a greater understanding of the region’s economy and community networks. While many fine national leadership development programs exist, we offer a regionally-focused program—taught by local leaders for local leaders.

volunteer_work.description: Central Iowa SHRM is dedicated to advancing the HR profession by providing members with opportunities to network with their peers, share and learn best practices, and grow their skills to impact their workplaces and drive organizational success.

recommendations:
Craig Damos



I have had the pleasure to work closely with Charlie over the past few years, and to serve as Charlie’s executive coach. I  watched her lead Amanda the Panda (an organization that amazingly serves annually over 1000 individuals who have lost a family loved one) from a non-profit with a strong reputation but had not progressed its business beyond “start-up”, to creating a path and effectively executing a viable and sustainable future for this valuable community enterprise. She is an electrifying leader with a strong desire to develop her leadership skills.

activities.title: Last night I was honored to accept Access Systems top sales award. I absolutely could not do what I do without the love and support of my family…
I am so grateful and humbled to have been recognized as Access Systems, Inc. Print Sales Rookie of The Year on Friday night. This award means alot to…
Our office dog Remi is getting in the holiday spirit all cozied up by the tree!
